reviewText: A few months ago, I had to completely overhaul my business Blowman's Bus Indeed  after coming under investigation with the department of health. It seemed the best way to further avoid unnecessary investigations and paperwork was to simply change my business plan. Too many parents had a problem with the mobile petting zoo and ice cream shop I ran from my renovated seatless school bus.With no formal refrigeration per say other than some coolers I picked up on clearance at Lowes. Remotely, I might see why some parents might complain. Most 'normal' kids do not eat their ice cream in a freezer, but they still had issue with that.As for the mobile petting zoo, I think they were out of line. After paying a small fare, individuals and tour groups would load up onto the bus as I drive it around the town. Many of the older or sickly animals were donated from shelters while others I would find as I drove about. For the most part, the animals were well-mannered. Keeping them in cages on a moving bus seemed rather pointless and simply cruel. Their areas were clearly marked with colored signs.You're welcome PETA.If and when any of the animals started to get slightly agitated with all the kids, I would break out the first aid kit. Then, I simply look for a place to pull the bus over and let the animal out. Preferably, a well-populated area like in front of a school, grocery store or freeway for someone else to find and care for it.Now, my bus still smelling like an animal kennel, has been converted into a mobile movie theater. I blacked out the windows with soap and spray paint, duct taped a few chairs, tables, couches and bean/dude bags. Taking refocussed liberties by stocking up on foods requiring little to no refrigeration by storing well in the summer months like boxed milk, Juice Boxes, alcohol (for the adults or relayed vebal consent) chocolates, gummy bears, nachos and popcorn. Initially, when I picked this movie up, I  thought that it would make for obvious great kiddie fare, but it turned out to be too scary. In fact, most of the kids would leave very ill. This just isn't something that I can honestly refer to other concerned parents.
summary: Movie is too scary for kids
Title: N/A

reviewText: Some of my best childhood memories, and favorite stories to tell while reminiscing with family members during get-togethers, are those times when a movie or TV show scared the daylights out of me. My poor Mom took me and my sister to see "Psycho" during it's initial run in theaters in 1960, I believe. I was 6 years old at the time and loved "monster" movies, and "scary" movies. She, and my sister and I, had no idea what we were in for. The original "Night of the Living Dead" was a grim, gut-wrenching hour and a half that left me and the rest of the Saturday afternoon matinee kids shell-shocked when I was about 13 or 14 years old.I watched "Toy Story of Terror" during its run on the Disney Channel during the Halloween season with my grownup children, and with a 5- and 8-year old brother and sister foster kids. Needless to say, we all loved it, and the little ones wanted to watch it each time it was broadcast. Sure it was scary, but in a "Scooby-Do" kind of way, and that's the fun of it. I will be ordering at least two copies of "Toy Story of Terror," one for the kids and one for me. If you love the "Toy Story" gang, you'll love this one, too!
Title: N/A

reviewText: We saw this as a special on television and absolutely loved it (keep in mind we are a family of adults).  Kept the recording on our DVR until we saw that the video is being released August 2014, and immediately ordered it.  It is a delightful treasure.
summary: Can barely wait for the video

reviewText: WOW!! I am so very happy that there is a new ''Toy Story'' movie.  I give it 5 stars because, well, I just love it so very very much. If you must know, I love all animation and cartoons for some reason and I'm now 27 years old and getting older as we all are; I don't know maybe its the fact that these kind of movies help me cope with life; and of course we all watched cartoons when we were little so I guess they kinda become GIUDE-LINES FOR OUR LIVES when we're older!! When it comes to movies like Toy Story........well, ''Its like the very air I breathe,'' says I. ''I simply cannot live without it, nobody can''. I will not tell you so much about this movie, but I will say that if you have the first three Toy Stories on DVD then you need this one as well, however it might be a little too creepy for some kids not all, but some. TRY IT OUT GUYS!!
summary: ''You Are a Sad Strange Little Man And You Have My Pity ''.
